com.highsoft.highcharts.Common.HIChartsClasses

Class HISunburst

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.Observable
      • com.highsoft.highcharts.Common.HIChartsClasses.HISeries
        • com.highsoft.highcharts.Common.HIChartsClasses.HISunburst
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    HIChartsJSONSerializable

    public class HISunburst
extends HISeries
    A sunburst series. If the type option is not specified, it is inherited from chart.type. Configuration options for the series are given in three levels: 1. Options for all series in a chart are defined in the [plotOptions.series](plotOptions.series) object. 2. Options for all sunburst series are defined in [plotOptions.sunburst](plotOptions.sunburst). 3. Options for one single series are given in [the series instance array](series.sunburst). Highcharts.chart('container', { plotOptions: { series: { // general options for all series }, sunburst: { // shared options for all sunburst series } }, series: [{ // specific options for this series instance type: 'sunburst' }] });

      • setLevelIsConstant

        public void setLevelIsConstant(java.lang.Boolean levelIsConstant)
        Used together with the levels and allowDrillToNode options. When set to false the first level visible when drilling is considered to be level one. Otherwise the level will be the same as the tree structure.

      • setSize

        public void setSize(java.lang.Object size)
        The diameter of the pie relative to the plot area. Can be a percentage or pixel value. Pixel values are given as integers. The default behaviour (as of 3.0) is to scale to the plot area and give room for data labels within the plot area. slicedOffset is also included in the default size calculation. As a consequence, the size of the pie may vary when points are updated and data labels more around. In that case it is best to set a fixed value, for example "75%".

        Try it:

         •  Smaller pie

      • getSize

        public java.lang.Object getSize()
